page.title: 04South Downs,Lancing & Sompt
page.content: The South Downs stretch for many miles from just north of Southhampton to Beachy Head. They provide excellant shelter for many villages which are tucked under the scarp slope.Also they shelter numerous coastal towns which are situated between the sea and the dip slope. The rolling south downs are scattered with lots of farms.Farm machinery cannot operate on the steep scarp slope and so this land is often used for grazing,sheep and cattle. Crops are often grown on the top flats of the Downs and the most common are barley and rape. The rape is grown for the oil which is contained in it's seeds.The yellow flowers of the rape provide a blaze of colour which can be seen from thecoast
